title: Pretty good
review:
My honest opinion about this device after 7 days of use 


PROS:-
 
1) price - main pros is its price 
2) built - built quality is really nice 
3) display - it has 720p hd display which is very good at this price 
4) battery - battery is good easily. If u r very heavy user it will easily last for 1 day . Normal and medium user it will last to 1.5 to 2 days 
5) speaker - speaker is nice because of placement of speaker with dolby atmos which will givd u crisp sound
6) charging - charging time is also good it charges 5000mah battery in almost 3 hrs which is good in my opinon
7) processor - although it do not has poweful processor but found no lag ( i m not a gamer but a moderate user )
8) memory - 3gb ram and 32 gb rom is very good deal in this price 
9) ram management - it has very good ram management at this price point 
10) fingerprint - finger print sensor is also good in my opinion 

CONS:- 

camera - the only con is camera is not that good as expected but u can take some desent (average) pics but do not expect too much with camera

Some other thing like i have faith in moto brand because earlier i used moto g3 which i loved a lot and moto has good reputation in the market and also flipkart service is also very good in my opinon. So if u found this review helpful do like this review :)

title: Excellent product for the price!
review:
Pros:
Good camera
battery life - single charge will go for days.
Low power consumption
Android N
Single button which can be used for finger print and multiple operation. If you don't like the back & home button displayed on the screen and is taking up space then configure moto actions and display, this is very useful. Then you get the whole screen and you can use the single button for various things, explore it.
Lot of features added to this phone. I am impressed.
Dolby sound. Very good.
HD display. I was watching a movie and display is clear.
Flash for front and back camera which is useful.
No heating issues yet with multiple apps opened.
Different display mode for night and day . You can set the time your day starts and ends.
No issues with Wi-Fi range. works well.
Look and feel is good.

Cons:
It is difficult to open the back cover. I struggled to open it for putting the SIM and SD card. Moto should have done a better job on this.

Overall good job Moto!

title: Nice product
review:
Well just with one day of usage I would like to comment -  it's a basic budget phone with few features added to gain attention and remain relevant in market. 

Display is bright, HD and does the job. 

Camera was disappointing in few indoors pics I tried,  maybe it's okay in outdoor. 

Handset speakers are good. 

Main compromise moto did is with  processor. Slight lag was evident from day one.  However,  it should be okay for basic usage like WhatsApp, Facebook, insta etc.  I personally felt moto should have put snapdragon even if prices increased by 1k.  It would have been a complete device then. 

The hype about os,  I found bloatware present i.e unjustified memory blockage.  

So my verdict -  moto has huge fan Base and brand value,  those who want the  best of moto,  they can go for it,  it looks elegant,  slightly heavy owing to battery and overall good device for regular use.  I purchased it for my dad for mails and social media. 

But those who are after performance and tech fanatics,  I would say this was moto's try to compete with Redmi Note 4 but choice of processor and excess loyalty to Google spoiled the fun.  
So, who should purchase? 
- first time 4G upgraders with limited usage,  govt/corporate people who need better back up,  moto fans and all those who need a decent  device under 10k.

Mobile photography enthusiasts,  Gamers,  tec savy guys, you won't be happy for sure! 

However, the biggest spoiler is,  Made In China  :P

Hope it helps :)

title: Packing the features in a limited budget.
review:
I have written this comprehensive review keeping in mind that I have bought a phone which is within the Rs. 10K limit. So, there will be no grousing on Corning Gorilla Glass, NFC or Qualcomm Snapdragon processor in this review.
There are a bunch of unexpected Pros and Cons in the device. I will elaborate each striking feature so that it will help my fellow buyers in deciding if the product will suit them or not. 

Pros: 

1. 2.5D Glass: This is exemplary for a phone in this budget. Together with its metal body design and embedded camera (similar to 5th Gen G-series), this phone gives an undoubted premium look. 

2. Dolby Atmos: The Moto E4 Plus is an audible delight. It outperforms Moto G5 and Moto X1 with its speakers as well as audio jack delivering one of the best sounds you can expect from a smartphone. 

3. Android 7.1.1 with 3GB RAM: There a quite a few Android Nougat phones in the market and owning the latest Android is something to brag. But it is essential to have sufficient RAM to utilize your smartphones to the fullest. My average RAM usage for 24 hours is 1.7 GB. Having a 2 GB RAM would be dreadful for both the product as well as the user. 

4. 32 GB ROM: The internal memory is sure to fulfil every user’s needs. With enough and more space for apps and multimedia, Moto has given a really good deal within 10K. It is commendable that Moto maintained a dedicated slot for expansion rather than a hybrid slot. 

5. 5000 mAH Battery: This striking feature at the product launch is efficacious. With rough usage, the battery ended the day at 33% which is indeed remarkable! Under fair usage, the battery may last 2-3 days. 

Cons: 

1. Camera: Although the camera specifications look promising, it doesn’t perform as expected. The quality is average but not bad. If someone is looking for a great camera smartphone, this is not the one. 

2. Non-removable battery: For most users, the whole purpose of a removable battery is to shut down the mobile if it gets hanged. In case of a non-removable battery, you will have to wait till the charge drains completely. Considering a 5000 mAH battery, it would inconveniently take days till you run out of charge. Hopefully, Moto has designed a counter feature to prevent this occurrence. 

3. Moto gestures: Moto did a pretty good job by providing gesture operations for camera, flashlight, etc in higher models. Moto E4 plus is an incomplete smartphone without these features.

Notable mentions: 

1. LED notification light: Many customers these days search for this feature. A cute little fancy dual colour notification light exists in this device to content the users. 

2. Performance: The MediaTek Quad Core isn’t really that big a disappointment! It runs Asphalt 8 and NFS No Limits without any lag though a certain lag is experienced while launching such games. 

3. Turbocharger: One must not be too keen on this feature as Moto E4 Plus is not equipped with USB type-C. The 10W charger just ensures that the mammoth battery charges quicker than conventional 4-6W chargers.

I know this might be one of the longest reviews on Flipkart, but if you liked it please give a thumbs up.

title: Good device for 10k with Moto Branding
review:
Updated review after usage of 4 months. 

Pros - 
-> Both Camera is ok (Good for this price range) + flash in front camera is advantage.
->32GB STORAGE AND 3 GB RAM which is really great for this price.
-> Battery backup is nice as it's 5000 mAh.
-> Charging time - from 0 to 100 it took 2hr 38 min for me, which is good for 5000mAh battery. 
-> Before this i own Moto-g5 plus, it looks identical with minor changes.
-> Display is good with 3d corning curve.
-> Smooth lag free working tll now.
-> Handset speakers are really good with loud sound. 
-> Looks ( Iron Grey). Looks superb just like a premium mobile. 
CONS - 
-> Most noticeable thing is - mediatek processor. so u can't expect very speed and performance so if you are into games and all I don't recommend this. 
Same phone launched in US with Snapdragon processor, this is sad part of it.
Here is the other moto E series phones.

Moto E 1 (Snapdragon 200)
Moto E 2 (Snapdragon 410 LTE)
Moto E 3 (MediaTek MT6735P)
Moto E 4 (MediaTek MT6737P)

We expect Snapdragon Chipset from Motorola only because E series started with Snapdragon and reached so far with MediaTek.

Hit 'Like' if you like the review. Thanks

title: Very Good
review:
Best smartphone under 10K.
All these specifications you find in this device usually cost around 12k with other brands.
Metal body gives a perfect look to the smartphone (Also, a bit heat up too)
The screen is 2.5D curve makes the smartphone even more stylish.
Camera is decent as expected under a 10K smartphone.. no complaint.
No hybrid slot as Xiomi, dual sim + seperate slot for memory card
Now, the main CON of the device, mediatek processor. You will notice the difference at the very first moment with the speed amd performance so if you are into games and all I don't recommend this.
Fingerprint sensor is average.

Overall the smartphone is 4/5, great value of money.

title: Best in the market!
review:
One of the gem and value for Money phone yet again by Motorola..
Few highlights:
Pros:
1. Attractive Price
2. 3 GB RAM work smoothly
3. Excellent battery 5000 mhz works full day with 4g network
4. Dolby Atmos sound too good for any video and audio
5. 5.5 screen size and awesome display with good touch screen.
6. 7.1.1 latest Android stock version excellent
7. Processor works nicely
8. fingerprint works perfectly
9. Front camera with flash too good.
10. One key navigation feature
11. Dual sim with dedicated memory slot

Cons:
1. Battery makes phone heavy Weight and looks bulky, 199 gram is too much weight for any phone.
2.Mediatek processor could have been snapdragon, same as USA version, if total installed apps goes beyond 70+ affects phone performance.
3. Back camera not upto the mark, photo quality is questionable and photos are hazy.
4. Back cover very difficult to open up and to remove SIM-1 is like hell.
4. If something goes wrong in warranty period , quality of Motorola centre's and arrogancey of service centre's guy's.

Will give 8.5 out of 10 for overall performance, and value for Money.

title: Feature rich mobile under 10k....
review:
Got it today, 14th July and after 5 hours of usage, writing this review. Hope it helps fellow buyers to choose the best as per their convinience.
1) Battery (10/10). Main USP of this mobile. Will update more in couple of days.
2) Android N 7.1.1 (9/10). Stock android with no problems at all.
3) Fingerprint (9/10). Works like charm.
4) Sound (9/10 speakers, 8/10 headset). With dolby atmos, speaker sound is fanatstic but lacks with headset. May be a better headset enhace the sound.
5) Looks (9/10, Iron Grey). Looks superb just like a premium mobile.
6) Lock screen notifications handling (8/10). New feature in Moto handsets, quite useful for people who get larger volume of notifications.
7) Weight, Bulkness (7/10). A bit bulky and heavy in comparison to latest mobiles in market, but that may attribute due to high capacity battery it contains. Not a problem for people who doesn't mind a little bulky phones.
8) RAM (8/10). Handles multitasking easily, noticed a few loading issues here n there but that is mainly due to the processor it contains.
9) Call Quality (9/10). No problems as such as of now.
10) Processor (6/10). The biggest drawback for this mobile is the Mediatek processor it has, though most of the mobiles in this segment comes with snapdragon but Moto chose to go with Mediatek. There is no comparison between both of these. Snapdragon is way way ahead of Mediatek. But again, to accomodate the prices under 10k segment and giving a feature rich mobile, motorola compromised with the processor. The mobile operations are a little bit on a heavier side, but works well.
11) Screen Display (8/10). HD display (1280 x 720 Pixels) not full hd. Viewing angles are good, display scores above average. 
12) Camera (7/10). Nothing to boast of. Both rear and front camera are for namesake. Don't buy this if you are looking for fantastic clicks,it won't give u that.

Disclaimer: I declare that the above review is totally unbiased and not intended to hurt anyboy's sentiments :)
Hit 'Like' if you like the review. Thanks

title: Excellent with very few cons
review:
The device is excellent for this price. 3 GB RAM and 32 GB Storage at this price is amazing. After a day of usage,

1. Camera is not so good, but not a deal breaker though.
2. Touch has some issues here and there when you flip to next page etc. That's slightly an issue till you get used to it.
3. Battery is just wow!
4. Fast in terms of performance.
5. Of course, the weight bothers you if you are an "always on mobile" type of user. 

Definitely worth the money. But as I compare it with my Moto G3, this is slightly below the standard.

Buy it. You won't regret.
